other_tests.findings: The twin with KH showed hypoglycemia (blood glucose 2.0 mmol/liter) after 18 h. The healthy twin remained normoglycemic throughout the test.
The plasma level of /H9252-hydroxybutyrate increased 10 times more in the twin with KH (mean 10.8 mmol/liter) compared to the healthy twin (mean 1.1 mmol/liter).
other_tests.changes_over_time: When repeated 7 months later, the maximum increase in /H9252-hydroxybutyrate was 5.0 mmol/liter in the KH twin and 1.3 mmol/liter in the healthy twin.

other_tests.findings: Blood glucose decreased to 2.3 mmol/liter after 12 h, along with pronounced ketonuria.
Hypoglycemia (p-glucose 2.2 mmol/liter) was found after a 15-h fast, along with pronounced ketonuria. No pathological organic aciduria noted.
